author: Richard B. Woodward
title: ‘Image Building: How Photography Transforms Architecture’ Review
text:
Watermill, N.Y. 
‘Image Building: How Photography Transforms Architecture” at the Parrish Art Museum is about the many ways that a camera can turn pile-driven structures of concrete and metal into cloudy symbols of high romance. 

The show features 21 artists and 57 examples of visual enticement. Dating from the 1930s to the present, they...
